sub_title: Healthcare researcher at Erasmus MC, Rotterdam, the Netherlands
summary: Dr. Margo van Mol has worked in the ICU for almost 30 years as a clinical nurse (registered). She holds an MSc in Health Psychology and epidemiology. Margo currently undertakes a post-doc fellowship in the ICU of Erasmus MC, an academic hospital in Rotterdam. Her research interests focus on the emotional impact of the ICU on patients and their relatives and the wellbeing of healthcare professionals. She has received several research grants for her projects and has publications in peer-reviewed journals.

treasury_media.title: Hoe combineer ik wetenschap en praktijkprojecten in persoonsgerichte zorg op de Intensive Care?
treasury_media.description:
In deze vlog laat ik zien hoe mijn onderzoekslijn naadloos aansluit bij de perspectieven uit de dagelijkse IC-praktijk.

De zorg op de IC kent heel veel aspecten, van high-tech en innovatieve behandelmethoden voor de patiënt tot ondersteunen en praten met naasten. Het geeft veel voldoening om vooral deze persoonlijke afstemming en interactie zo goed mogelijk vorm te geven.

treasury_media.title: Mijn onderzoekslijn; Person-centered Care in the intensive care unit

profile_positions.description:
Research line: “Improving (long-term) health outcomes of patients and relatives in a person-centered intensive care unit and promoting the wellbeing of professionals”. 
- 2022. Intensive care follow-up service: Developing and implementing a nurse-led e-health intervention for relatives of intensive care survivors; ICNaVEN-study [Intensive Care Nazorgtraject: het ontwikkelen en implementeren van een Verpleegkundig geleide EHealth interventie voor Naasten van voormalig IC-patiënten]
- 2022. Diary Implementation as a prelude to integrated interventions in person-centred care in the Intensive Care Unit; DIPIC-study [Dagboek Implementatie als opmaat naar geïntegreerde interventies in Persoonsgerichte zorg op de Intensive Care afdeling]
- 2021. Priorities for a research agenda, perspectives of ICU survivors and relatives in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
"Verpleging In Progressie, Verbinding In Professie"
Nursing Council of Erasmus MC
profile_positions.title: Member Nursing Council, VAR (previous Verpleegkundige Raad VIP²)

profile_positions.description:
My research line is 'Person-centered care in the intensive care unit'
•	The BRIC study; a mixed method study to evaluate a nurse led intervention with an exploration of complicated grief and identifying experiences of the relatives: I am the principal investigator and project leader in the study.
•	Implementation and effectiveness of POST-ICU-diary, a digital diary tool supporting relatives in the ICU. I am the project leader and principal investigator in this multicenter study.
•	A mixed method study for a needs assessment of supportive interventions on vitality and resilience after COVID-19 among employees of Erasmus MC. I am the principal investigator and project leader.
•	CoMentIC study, a cross-sectional survey on the impact of COVID-19 on the Mental health of ICU nurses in the Netherlands.
•	RELACS; a randomized controlled trial to assess the effect of music intervention on the level of anxiety in ICU patients. I am co-investigator in this study.
•	An implementation study on discharge from an ICU to the follow-up ward in Erasmus MC: I was principal investigator. 
•	Collaboration in a follow-up of former ICU patients, balance-training: I was a co-investigator of this study. 
•	A systematic review on rooming-in at adult wards: I was the co-investigator of this study. 
•
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: The production and publicaton of a scientific journal for nurses. The aim is to pay attention to all the nursing research, the involved nurses in the Erasmus MC, and to educate scientific language.
profile_positions.title: Editor in chief "VIP Science"

profile_positions.description: I became aware of nursing leadership and evidence-based care. Therefore, I have been an active member of the Nursing Council VIP2 (“Verpleegkunde in Progressie, Verbinding in Professie”) of Erasmus MC from its beginning in 2010 and was president of VIP2 from 2016 to 2018.
profile_positions.title: President of the Nursing Council of Erasmus MC

profile_positions.description: In 1984 I started my carrier as a nurse student and since 1989 I have worked as a registered nurse in Erasmus MC. After three years as Specialist Nurse Obstetrics and Gynaecology, I followed a training in the intensive care unit (ICU), in which I now have over 25 years’ experience. During my work as an ICU nurse I followed the BSc course of Nursing Informatics (University of Applied Sciences, Diemen) and graduated in 2002 on the implementation of a Patient Data Management System. Until mid-2017 I have been employed as a clinical nurse involved in daily patient care at the adult ICU of Erasmus MC.
profile_positions.title: Intensive Care Nurse General ICU

profile_positions.description:
During my Master study of Health Psychology (2006-2013), I became inspired to improve the support of relatives in the ICU. This passion has led to the implementations and coordination of various projects in family-centered care in Erasmus MC, the participation in several committees supporting person-centered care, and the involvement in a national foundation of FCIC (Family and patient Centered Intensive Care). 
Currently focussing on two themes:
- work engagement among ICU professionals
- the transition proces of ICU patients to the general ward

profile_positions.description: Initiator of Family-centered Care in the adult ICUs in the Erasmus MC. With a team we introduced several interventions additional to the exitsting policy to support the relatives of the patient.
profile_positions.title: Project leader Family-centered Care

profile_positions.description: The starting proces in the development and validation of a new tool to measure satisfaction of relatives in the ICU, which is conducted in a co-creation with the HAN, Gelderse Vallei and Kennemer Gasthuis.
